name: sillily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows little thought or judgment: She smiled more falsely and sillily than ever. He was enjoying the enchantment of being sillily in love.
More examplesFewer examplesI think you're lying quite sillily.You have spent the money sillily and thoughtlessly, which really is far worse than being extravagant.He sillily laughed a couple of times and said: "Yes, of course!""There's no need for anything like this," she said, grinning more falsely and sillily than ever.
